groups.name: Things You Wear on Your Feet

easy.notes: Categories: 1) Things with Tails = animals that have tails. 2) Things You Can Bake = edible items that can be baked. 3) Things That Fly (Non-birds) = things that fly but are not birds. 4) Things You Wear on Your Feet = footwear. Near-miss temptation: 'plane' could feel like a 'flyer' in multiple groups, but it's best kept in its own flying item group.

medium.notes: Categories: 1) Word Fragments: items built from short word pieces (sun/set, snow/seed). 2) Colorful Pairs: common compound words that pair a color with another concept. 3) Small Tools: hand tools often found in a toolbox. 4) Room Furnishings: items you typically find inside a room. Near-miss temptation: 'lamp' could be mistaken with 'light' in 'Colorful Pairs' if not careful; kept distinct by established compound forms.

hard.notes: Categories: 1) Opposites in Motion: group around actions that are antonyms or counterpoints used in motion. 2) Tiny Creatures in Pables: very small animals; ensure each fits as a standalone entry. 3) Words With Shared Endings: words ending similarly (-ful) to show pattern; careful to avoid duplicates. 4) Everyday Objects with Hidden Uses: common items that can be used in unusual ways. Near-miss temptation: 'move' in Opposites in Motion might tempt to group with 'pause' as a pair, but 'stop' and 'pause' are closer opposites; 'move' stands as a separate action here.
